title: Woody Allen: an American comedy
creator_credit: Films for the Humanities and Harold Mantell
brief_description: Woody Allen talks about his life and work as a writer, dramatist and film-maker and discusses his creative sources, theoretical approaches and working methods. Shows scenes from some of his major films including “Annie Hall”, “Love and Death”, “Sleep”, “The Night Club Years” and “Take the money and run”.
